Hi! I am working on a public app. In one of my actions to CRM card I want to update company properties. How do I manage a refresh token / access token to use this API <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/companies/{companyId}> from my public app?
is only option to store refresh tokens in a database?

This call is being made on the client side? If so, that’s a big security no-no. I recommend avoiding exposing auth credentials on the frontend.

A much more secure, and easier solution would be to use the following endpoint - <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form>

Create a HubSpot form that will take care of that contact creation for you?

That is, if a standard embedded HubSpot form isn’t a viable option for you.

As a general rule, you’re much better off making these kinds of requests on the server side.

<@U039PUBV59N>
how to integrate the forms API to your react app
How can I create contact on HubSpot by using Form API?
thanks.  i see that you just opened it yesterday so i will keep an eye on it

Update: solved,
add `type => string` to the array
------------------------------------------------------------
I'm trying to create a contact property but got error. how do I solve this error?
code (PHP / Laravel):
```$propertyCreate = new PropertyCreate([
    'name' => 'my_label',
    'label' => 'My Label',
    'field_type' => 'text',
    'group_name' => 'contactinformation',
]);```
error:
```{"status":"error","message":"Invalid input JSON on line 1, column 92. Some required fields were not set: [type]","correlationId":"5fa874f6-2411-40fc-9bf8-cc8bd72ad195","category":"VALIDATION_ERROR"}```
Thanks Jose Figueiredo. That is the solution.
Ah, I see it now. Brother, you're a genius!
np bro
Another question, do you know how I can prevent the HubSpot token from expiring in 30 minutes?
I want to know if there's any best practice for this
you can't prevent it from expiring but you can just refresh it before it expires
or if you get a failed call you can just refresh it then
Ah, okay. Thanks, bro, you helped me a lot
of course bro, hit me up if you run into any issues

Hey folks. Sorry if this has been asked before, but it's kind of hard to search for. I'm starting a new integration using the API, and I'm wondering if I should be using v3 or v4?

For example, the link to "Read the developer documentation" on this page, <https://www.HubSpot.com/products/marketing/transactional-email>, takes me to a page that has v3 examples (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/marketing/transactional-emails>).

But I've also come across similar documentation that has v4 examples: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/marketing/single-send-api>

Anyone got good info on the open api? 
Got GPT to work but arguments are not great anyone got it working better?

strangeness… I used to be able to do /crm/v3/lists/search but now I get `Requesting portal does not have access to this endpoint` (401) ?
 /crm/v3/lists/:listId/memberships DO work with the same credentials

Hi all, we are creating a workflow which validates a property information from Salesforce and then deletes the record if incorrect. For this we are using Salesforce APIs. It works fine for less volume but if we enroll more than 3600 records at once, salesforce auth API fails because of hourly auth limits in Salesforce.

Is there a way we could store the auth token of Salesforce somewhere in HubSpot and use the same for 2 hours(Salesforce token stays valid for 2 hours) and when it fails, then only we generate a new token.
Thank you in advance!

All - We are using HubSpot as a CRM solution.
We are creating Contacts and companies in HubSpot and my sales team are doing the updates such as adding comments to the leads.

The task I have is > to identify the contacts or companies whihc has some modifications or updates in the last 24 hours.
I am running into API rate limiters while trying to fetch the records to see if they are modified. I did tried batching also.

Is there any API or a possible way to fetch the contacts which has modifications or modifications to a specific attribute/property so that I can work on those limited contacts alone.

You can create an active list in HubSpot of contacts created/modified in last 24 hours, then use this as your reference to do any data manipulations on those records
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/lists>

<@U065ZS3F6JW>> thank you for responding.

How can I create a list with contacts created/modified in last 24 hours > I don’t want to do it manually and instead looking for a config/programatic way of defining a list and all contacts who gets modified will get automatically added to the list
List creation would be one time manual activity
and you can refer to this list everytime through list API endpoint
